thread.title: Read the 9th Circuit Court's immigration ruling
thread.title_full: Read the 9th Circuit Court's immigration ruling

author: USA TODAY
title: Read the 9th Circuit Court's immigration ruling
text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Read the 9th Circuit Court's immigration ruling The 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals denied the Trump administration's appeal seeking to reinstate the president's travel ban. Post to Facebook Read the 9th Circuit Court's immigration ruling The 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals denied the Trump administration's appeal seeking to reinstate the president's travel ban. Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/2kU4IC4 Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Read the 9th Circuit Court's immigration ruling William Cummings , USA TODAY Published 7:09 p.m. ET Feb. 9, 2017 | Updated 11 minutes ago 24 Shares 
Opponents of President Trump's executive order imposing a temporary immigration ban on seven Muslim-majority nations protest outside a federal appeals court in San Francisco earlier this week. (Photo: Elijah Nouvelage, Getty Images) 
The 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals denied the Trump administration's appeal seeking to reinstate President Donald Trump’s ban on travelers from seven predominantly Muslim nations in a unanimous decision Thursday. 
The three-judge panel rejected the Justice Department claim that the court lacked the authority to review the president's executive order. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Sabita Manian and her husband Brad Bollock hold signs and protest during a march against President Trump's immigration policies in Lynchburg, Va. Feb, 5, 2017. Jay Westcott, AP Anti-Trump protests in Houston near the super bowl site, Feb. 5, 2017. Josh Peters, USA TODAY Sports Supporters of President Donald Trump hold a rally near Trump Tower in New York, Feb. 5, 2017. Bryan R. Smith, AFP/Getty Images Anti-Trump protesters shout at supporters of President Trump during a rally in New York, Feb, 5, 2017. BRYAN R. SMITH, AFP/Getty Images Cynthia Hudson holds a sign during a protest against President Trump's immigration policies in Lynchburg, Va. Feb. 5, 2017. Jay Westcott People hold candles during a vigil in front of the Lincoln Memorial on Feb. 4, 2017 in Washington, D.C. The vigil was held in solidarity with protests against President Trump's travel ban. Zach Gibson, Getty Images Protesters hold signs during a rally by the International Migrants Alliance to protest against President Trump and his recent immigration and refugee restrictions, outside the U.S. consulate in Hong Kong on Feb. 5, 2017. Isaac Lawrence, AFP/Getty Images People protest against President Trump at the entrance to the Mar-a-Lago Resort where he is staying for the weekend on Feb. 4, 2017, in Palm Beach, Fla. Joe Raedle, Getty Images Demonstrators holding placards march in central London during a protest against US President Donald Trump on February 4, 2017. Niklas Halle'n, AFP/Getty Images Demonstrators holding placards take part in a protest against US President Donald Trump outside the US Embassy in London on February 4, 2017. Niklas Halle'n, AFP/Getty Images Fullscreen People hold a banner reading "Make America hate again" during a gathering to protest U.S. President Donald Trump's recent travel ban to the U.S. at Trocadero Plaza next to the Eiffel Tower in Paris, Saturday, Feb. 4, 2017. People gathered to protest Trump's executive order temporarily banning immigrants from seven Muslim-majority countries from entering the U.S. and suspending the nation's refugee program. Kamil Zihnioglu, AP Fullscreen Muslim activists hold posters depicting U.S. President Donald Trump during a protest outside the U.S. Embassy in Jakarta, Indonesia on Feb. 4, 2017. Dozens of students and activists from several rights groups staged the protest calling on the Indonesian government and the international community to help stop Trump's order that temporarily banned travelers from seven predominantly Muslim countries. Dita Alangkara, AP People take part in a demonstration against US President Donald J. Trump in central London on February 4, 2017. Sean Dempsey, European Pressphoto Agency People take part in a demonstration against US President Donald J. Trump in London. Sean Dempsey, European Pressphoto Agency Fullscreen Filipino protestors burn a portrait of US President Donald J. Trump during a protest rally at the US Embassy in Manila, Philippines. The protesters showed opposition to the refusal of administration of US President Donald J. Trump to accept the entry of immigrants from Syria, Libya, Iraq, Somalia, Iran, Sudan, and Yemen. Francis R. Malasig, European Pressphoto Agency Fullscreen A protester holds a plaque with a portrait of Trump reading 'Nope' which resembles Shepard Fairey's poster of former US president Obama during an anti Trump rally in front of the Brandenburg Gate in Berlin, Germany. Many people demonstrated in Berlin against US President Trump's ban on travel for Muslims from various regions. Clemens Bilan, European Pressphoto Agency Fullscreen A Indonesian muslim activist speaks through a megaphone during a protest against US President Donald J. Trump in front of the US Embassy in Jakarta, Indonesia. Dozens of Indonesian protesters gathered to demonstrate against Trump's controversial executive order banning the US from taking in people from Muslim-majority countries. Bagus Indahono, European Pressphoto Agency Fullscreen Protestors and LGBT activists march toward the White House after rallying outside of Trump International Hotel, February 3, 2017 in Washington, DC. The protest was organized by the group 'WERK for Peace,' and they aimed to let President Trump know 'discrimination, bigotry, and hate are not tolerated in our country.' Drew Angerer, Getty Images Protestors write messages directed toward President Donald Trump on lanterns near the Washington Monument, February 3, 2017 in Washington, DC. The protest is aimed at President Trump's travel ban policy. Drew Angerer, Getty Images People protest President Trump's executive order during a refugee vigil at the Coleman Park Community Center in Antioch, Tenn. Andrew Nelles, The Tennessean, via USA TODAY Network Demonstrators protest President Trump's executive immigration order on Feb. 1, 2017 in Chicago, Illinois. Joshua Lott, AFP/Getty Images From left, Asli Ali, 39, of Woodburn, Dana Bliss, 56, and Kristen Wilson, 58, attend an immigrant and refugee rights rally at Oregon State Capitol on Feb. 1, 2017 in Salem, Oregon. Anna Reed, Statesman Journal, via USA TODAY Network Sloan Robbins, 6, of Nashville, holds a candle during a vigil and rally for immigrants and refugees at the Coleman Park Community Center in Antioch, Tenn. Andrew Nelles, The Tennessean, USA TODAY Network People hold placards during a gathering to protest President Trump's recent travel ban to the U.S., in Paris on Jan. 31, 2017. Ian Langsdon, European Pressphoto Agency Americans and other expatriates gather to protest President Trump's recent travel ban outside of the U.S. Embassy in Tokyo on Jan. 31, 2017. Eugene Hoshiko, AP Fullscreen People hold candles during a vigil at Thanksgiving Square in downtown Dallas on Jan. 30, 2017. People gathered to protest against President Donald Trump's executive order temporarily banning immigrants from seven Muslim-majority countries from entering the U.S. and suspending the nation's refugee program. LM Otero, AP People rally to protest President Trump's recent executive order on immigration in Jersey City, N.J. on Jan. 30, 2017. Demitrius Balevski, Northjersey.Com, via USA TODAY Networ Demonstrators hold up signs during a protest outside Downing Street against President Trump's ban on travel from seven Muslim countries on Jan. 30, 2017 in London. Jack Taylor, Getty Images Fullscreen Robert May, left, and Sarah Dizio hold signs in the arrivals terminal at San Francisco International Airport to protest President Trump's executive order that bars citizens of seven predominantly Muslim-majority countries from entering the U.S. on Jan. 30, 2017 in San Francisco. Marcio Jose Sanchez, AP Thousands of people protest against the U.S. immigration policy of President Trump at the United States embassy in Ottawa, Ontario on Jan. 30, 2017. Fred Chartrand, The Canadian Press, via AP Demonstrators chant outside the U.S. Consulate during a protest against President Trump's executive order banning citizens of seven majority-Muslim countries from entering the United States in Toronto on Jan. 30, 2017. Frank Gunn, The Canadian Press, via AP Protestors gather outside 10 Downing Street in London on Jan. 30, 2017. Thousands of demonstrators gathered in London to protest President Trump's controversial executive order. Facundo Arrizabalaga, European Pressphoto Agency Demonstrators march from the Mound to the Scottish Parliament to protest against President Trump's Muslim travel ban on Jan. 30, 2017 in Edinburgh, Scotland. Mark Runnacles, Getty Images Fullscreen A group of people, including employees of the Washington state Attorney General's office, listen in the back of a briefing room during a news conference on Jan. 30, 2017, in Seattle. Attorney General Bob Ferguson announced that he is suing President Donald Trump over an executive order that suspended immigration from seven countries with majority-Muslim populations and sparked nationwide protests. Ted S. Warren, AP People stand outside of Sen. Roy Blunt's office in Springfield, Mo. to protestPresident Trump's recent executive order on immigration on Jan. 30, 2017. Andrew Jansen, News-Leader, via USA TODAY Andy Sun, of Springfield, Mo, along with other protestors stands outside of Sen. Roy Blunt's office to protest President Trump's recent executive order on immigration. Andrew Jansen, News-Leader, via USA TODAY Khulud Fidama, 26, of Dearborn, Mich., stands with her family outside the McNamara Terminal at Detroit Metro Airport to speak out against the recent executive order signed by President Trump on Jan. 29, 2017. Elaine Cromie, Detroit Free Press, via USA TODAY Network Malik Assi, 12, of Dearborn, holds a sign outside the Henry Ford Centennial Library in Dearborn to protest the recent executive order signed by President Trump. Elaine Cromie, Detroit Free Press, via USA TODAY Network Fullscreen Thousands of people protest President Trump's immigration ban on citizens from seven majority-Muslim countries outside the White House in Washington, DC on January 29, 2017. On January 28, a federal judge in Brooklyn temporary blocked the executive ban, which had stranded as many as 200 inbound foreigners at U.S. ports of entry. Jim Lo Scalzo, European Pressphoto Agency People protest President Trump's immigration ban on citizens from seven majority-Muslim countries outside the White House in Washington, D.C. Jim Lo Scalzo, European Pressphoto Agency Fullscreen Demonstrators gather near The White House to protest President Trump's travel ban on seven Muslim countries on January 29, 2017 in Washington. President Trump signed the controversial executive order that halted refugees and residents from predominantly Muslim countries from entering the United States. Zach Gibson, Getty Images Demonstrators gather near The White House to protest President Trump's travel ban on seven Muslim countries. Zach Gibson, Getty Images People gather in Copley Square to protest the immigration ban enacted by President Trump on January 29, 2017. Saturday night, two federal judges issued a temporary emergency order halting part of the ban. Darren McCollester, Getty Images People gather in Copley Square to protest the immigration ban enacted by President Trump. Darren McCollester, Getty Images People gather in Copley Square in Boston to protest the immigration ban enacted by President Trump. Darren McCollester, Getty Images People gather in Copley Square in Boston to protest the immigration ban enacted by President Trump on January 29, 2017. Darren McCollester, Getty Images Senator Liz Warren (D-Mass.) speaks to people gathered in Copley Square in Boston to protest the immigration ban enacted by President Trump. Darren McCollester, Getty Images People attend an afternoon rally in Battery Park in New York to protest President Trump's immigration policies. Spencer Platt, Getty Images People attend an afternoon rally in Battery Park to protest President Trump's new immigration policies. Spencer Platt, Getty Images Thousands of protesters crowd Philadelphia International Airport Sunday to speak out against the president's temporary ban on refugees from seven Muslim-majority countries. Suchat Pederson, The News Journal via USA TODAY NETWORK Thousands of protesters cheer as a car drives by in support of their protest at Philadelphia International Airport. Suchat Pederson, The News Journal via USA TODAY NETWORK Demonstrators protest against President Trump's executive immigration ban at Chicago O'Hare International Airport on January 28, 2017. President Donald Trump signed the controversial executive order that halted refugees and residents from predominantly Muslim countries from entering the United States. Joshua Lott, AFP/Getty Images Fullscreen Sergio Martinez, center, a teacher at Sparks Elementary School in La Puente, Calif., joins hundreds of others as California educators voice their opposition to President Trump's nomination of Betsy DeVos as Secretary of Education, at a California Teachers Association meeting in Los Angeles on Jan. 28, 2017. Reed Saxon, AP Demonstrators gather outside the federal courthouse in Milwaukee on January 28, 2017, to protest the executive order signed by President Trump that bans refugees from seven nations. Bill Glauber, Milwaukee Journal-Sentinel via AP People gather outside of the US District Court in New York, where a judge issued an emergency stay for those detained at airports on January 28, 2017. Andrew Gombert, European Pressphoto Agency People gather outside of the U.S. District Court in New York, where a judge issued an emergency stay for those detained at airports on January 28, 2017. Andrew Gombert, European Pressphoto Agency Anti-Trump protestors fill the international hall inside the Philadelphia International Airport on January 28, 2017. Joe Lamberti, Courier-Post via USA Today Network Area Muslims and local immigration activists participate in a prayer and rally against President Trump's immigration policies in New York. Spencer Platt, Getty Images Isaias Juarez with his daughter's Anarhu joins a gathering in downtown Durham, N.C., Friday, to show their support for refugees and immigrants and stand against President Trump's plan to ban refugees of Muslim countries. Bernard Thomas, The Herald-Sun via AP Muslims and immigration activists participate in a prayer service and rally in New York City. Spencer Platt, Getty Images Fullscreen Cousins Shabnaj, left, and Taslima Choudhury, center, of Queens, New York, pray during Jummah, a Muslim prayer service, in Foley Square. The rally and prayer service sponsored by the New York Immigration Coalition and the Inter-Faith Clergy of New York City was in support of Muslims and immigrants. Mary Altaffer, AP People participate in a prayer service and rally against President Trump's immigration policies in New York. Spencer Platt, Getty Images Hundreds of people gathered in downtown Durham, N.C., to show their support for refugees and immigrants and stand against President Trump's plan to ban refugees of Muslim countries. Bernard Thomas, AP Women listen to a speaker as people rally against President Trump's immigration policies in New York. Spencer Platt, Getty Images A view from the downtown rally in Durham, N.C., Friday, to show their support for refugees and immigrants and stand against President Trump's plan to ban refugees of Muslim countries. Bernard Thomas, AP People gather for an interfaith rally to show support for the Muslim and immigrant communities in New York. The rally was organized in response to proposed actions by President Trump. JUSTIN LANE, EPA People gather in Durham, N.C., to show their support for refugees and immigrants. Bernard Thomas, AP People listen during an interfaith rally in Foley Square to show support for the Muslim and immigrant communities. Jusin Lane, EPA People rally to show support for the Muslim and immigrant communities in New York. Justin Lane, EPA Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay
